questions.question: Which mission conducted a 'grand tour' of the outer planets?
What did the Voyager mission reveal about Jupiter's moon Io?
Which mission spent over a decade studying the Saturnian system?
What did the Cassini mission discover on Saturn's moon Titan?
Which moon of Saturn was found to have geysers of water ice erupting from its south pole?
What celestial body did the New Horizons mission study in detail in 2015?
What unexpected feature was discovered on Pluto by New Horizons?
Which mission successfully landed a probe on a comet?
What is the name of the comet studied by the Rosetta mission?
What is the primary objective of the OSIRIS-REx mission?
Which asteroid is the target of the OSIRIS-REx mission?
What is the transit method used for in exoplanet research?
choices: Detecting planets passing in front of stars
questions.answer: Detecting planets passing in front of stars

questions.question: Which space telescope used the transit method to discover thousands of exoplanets?
What does the radial velocity method measure to detect exoplanets?
Which of these is an advantage of space-based observations over ground-based ones?
What type of exoplanets did the Kepler mission reveal to be prevalent?
What is the primary focus of the TESS mission?
choices: Finding Earth-sized planets in habitable zones
questions.answer: Finding Earth-sized planets in habitable zones

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a major discovery from the Voyager missions?
What did the Cassini-Huygens mission reveal about Enceladus?
choices: It has a strong magnetic field

questions.question: What unexpected feature did New Horizons discover on Pluto?
Why is studying comets and asteroids important for understanding Earth?
choices: They provide insights into early solar system formation
questions.answer: They provide insights into early solar system formation

questions.question: What is a limitation of the transit method for detecting exoplanets?
choices: It can only detect large planets
It requires the planet's orbit to align with our line of sight
It can't provide information about the planet's mass
It only works for nearby stars
questions.answer: It requires the planet's orbit to align with our line of sight

questions.question: Which space telescope is designed to survey the 200,000 brightest stars near Earth?
What type of planets is the radial velocity method most effective at detecting?
choices: Massive planets close to their stars
Gas giants in the habitable zone
questions.answer: Massive planets close to their stars

questions.question: What did the Cassini mission discover about Titan's surface?
choices: It has a rocky surface similar to Mars

questions.question: Which mission provided evidence for a possible subsurface ocean on Pluto?
What is the significance of studying small bodies like comets and asteroids?
choices: They are potential sources of valuable minerals
They could be used as refueling stations for spacecraft
They provide insights into early solar system formation
They are candidates for future human colonization
questions.answer: They provide insights into early solar system formation

questions.question: What advantage do space-based telescopes have over ground-based ones for exoplanet detection?
choices: They are free from atmospheric interference
They are less expensive to operate
questions.answer: They are free from atmospheric interference

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a method commonly used for exoplanet detection from space?
What did the Rosetta mission reveal about comets?
choices: They are composed entirely of ice
They have complex surface features and compositions
They are remnants of ancient planets
questions.answer: They have complex surface features and compositions
